alert.note: Alert for Belmont; Guernsey; Monroe; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 3:17PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN GUERNSEY... NORTHWESTERN MONROE...SOUTHWESTERN BELMONT AND NOBLE COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 316 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Byesville to near Caldwell. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Barnesville, Caldwell, Dudley, Bethesda, Quaker City, Senecaville, Belmont, Pleasant City, Lore City, Summerfield, Belle Valley, and Lewisville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio near mile marker 184. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 23 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
